CatDescriptText: Mae Jones, widow, Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe Negroes, who get public assistance, do more cheating than whites?" answer reads: "I don't think that one group of people cheats more than the other. There are persons who cheat at public assistance and I think that this, in itself, is a sad state of affairs.  However, that's just the way the cookie crumbles."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mae Jones wearing earrings and dark jacket with feather shaped brooch on left lapel, standing on sidewalk in front of stone building
